clinical_study.brief_title: Immune Modulation Study in Patients With Metastatic Melanoma Treated With Anti-PD1 Monoclonal Antibodies
clinical_study.official_title: Immune Modulation Study in Patients With Metastatic Melanoma Treated With Anti-PD1 Monoclonal Antibodies

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open mono-centric prospective non-randomized study in patients with metastatic melanoma treated with Anti-PD1 monoclonal antibodies (Nivolumab). The aim of the study is to identify the immune cells modulations differences between patients who present a complete, partial or stable response and patients who have non-response to the therapy in order to establish an improving response rate strategy.

primary_outcome.measure: change the absolute number of dendritic cells before treatment and on treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: before treatment (week 0), at week 2, at week 12, at week 54 or at relapse (before 54 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: absolute number / mm 3 of dendritic cells

primary_outcome.measure: change the percentage of cells producing cytokines in dendritic cells before treatment and on treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: before treatment (week 0), at week 2, at week 12, at week 54 or at relapse (before 54 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: % of cells producing cytokines in dendritic cells

primary_outcome.measure: change the absolute number of subpopulations of T lymphocytes before treatment and on treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: before treatment (week 0), at week 2, at week 12, at week 54 or at relapse (before 54 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: absolute number / mm 3 of different subpopulations of T lymphocyte

primary_outcome.measure: change the absolute number of monocytes before treatment and on treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: before treatment (week 0), at week 2, at week 12, at week 54 or at relapse (before 54 weeks)

primary_outcome.measure: change the percentage of cells producing cytokines in subpopulations of T lymphocytes before treatment and on treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: before treatment (week 0), at week 2, at week 12, at week 54 or at relapse (before 54 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: % of cells producing cytokines in subpopulations of T lymphocytes

primary_outcome.measure: change the percentage of cells producing cytokines in monocytes before treatment and on treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: before treatment (week 0), at week 2, at week 12, at week 54 or at relapse (before 54 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: % of cells producing cytokines in monocytes

secondary_outcome.measure: correlation between biological parameters and progression-free survival
secondary_outcome.time_frame: progression between the date of first injection of immunotherapy and week 54 based on RECIST and ir-RECIST criterion
secondary_outcome.description: absolute number / mm 3 of different population of cells and % of cells producing cytokines in the different population of cells will be correlated with the progression free survival

secondary_outcome.measure: correlation between biological parameters on overall survival
secondary_outcome.time_frame: death between the date of first injection of immunotherapy and week 54
secondary_outcome.description: absolute number / mm 3 of different population of cells and % of cells producing cytokines in the different population of cells will be correlated with the overall survival

secondary_outcome.measure: Identify predictive factors of overall response rate at week 12 based on RECIST and ir-RECIST criteria
secondary_outcome.description: predictive factors like histological and cytological initial tumor type, initial immunological status will be evaluated at inclusion and correlated with the response

secondary_outcome.measure: impact of treatments received prior to inclusion in the study on the biological parameters before and on treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: antitumor treatment received from diagnosis of melanoma to inclusion
secondary_outcome.description: absolute number / mm 3 of different population of cells and % of cells producing cytokines in the different population of cells will be correlated with treatments received prior to inclusion

secondary_outcome.measure: correlation between the occurrence of autoimmune side effects and the biological parameters before and on treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: occurence of autoimmune side effects from day 0 to week 54
secondary_outcome.description: absolute number / mm 3 of different population of cells and % of cells producing cytokines in the different population of cells will be correlated with autoimmune side effects, based on CTCAE classification

Inclusion Criteria:

- Patient with metastatic or unresectable melanoma
- Anti-PD1 monoclonal antibodies treatment indication
- Patient affiliated to a social security regime
- Signed Written Informed Consent.
- agree with the storage of his biological samples
- Women of childbearing potential must as mentioned in the summary of product characteristics (SPC) using two effective methods of contraception during treatment, and men whose partner is of childbearing potential must use effective contraception during treatment. For all patients treated men and women, contraception should be continued during the four months following the discontinuation of nivolumab.
Exclusion Criteria:
- development of haematological tumor during treatment
- Patients requiring concomitant chronic treatment with systemic corticosteroids or other immunosuppressive agents
- Patients with autoimmune disease.
- Patient with Occular melanoma
